meanings.definition: To qualify or be qualified in advance
meanings.sent1: She prequalifies for the scholarship based on her excellent grades.
meanings.sent2: He prequalifies for the job because he has the required experience.
meanings.sent3: The cat prequalifies for the race by being the fastest in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His dedication prequalifies him as a top candidate for the promotion.
meanings.sent5: The early submission prequalifies her for the competition, giving her an advantage.

meanings.definition: To meet the necessary requirements beforehand
meanings.sent1: The completed application prequalifies him for the next round of interviews.
meanings.sent2: Meeting the deadline prequalifies her for the special discount.
meanings.sent3: His love for pizza prequalifies him as a potential taste tester.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking prequalifies her as a problem solver in the team.
meanings.sent5: The thorough preparation prequalifies them for success in the project.
